content:
@Sherry Lake thanks for announcing the next large data working group meeting during the community call.

No good deed will go unpunished!

Are you interested in create a webpage for the group? You could model a PR of this one, if you like: https://github.com/gdcc/www.gdcc.io/pull/9

Current the link at https://www.gdcc.io/working-groups.html for the large data group points at Zulip thread but we'd change it to point at the new webpage.

Yes, I can do that.
I'll contact Sonia and Ceilyn first to make sure it's OK to add to GDCC pages.

No rush.

I think I created the page correctly this time - and added all the links/info.

I made a copy of the sensitive data page (which is the first PR) then updated my copy with the large data info (2nd PR).

Not sure why it's two separate PRs, I thought it would only be one :woman_shrugging:

Thanks for working on this, @Sherry Lake!

Can you close the PR you don't want?
PR Closed... sorry just now reading this..... this afternoon I went down an embargo rabbit hole, which I will report on tomorrow. Or Thursday, after repeating on demo.dataverse.
I made a couple tweaks to https://github.com/gdcc/www.gdcc.io/pull/41 and merged it! Thanks, @Sherry Lake!

Thanks @Philip Durbin ☃️
@Ceilyn Boyd @Sonia Barbosa
How does it look?

Philip Durbin ☃️ said:

Sherry Lake thanks for announcing the next large data working group meeting during the community call.

Did the Feb meeting happen? I don't see anything in the running notes. In the community news I'm planning on announcing the new webpage, at least.

Sorry, just getting to reply. I don't remember updating the notes document. Sonia just walked us (there were only 2 non-IQSS folks) through the Large Data Intake form and answered questions about the Harvard Dataverse Repository Large Data Services document.

Sonia's updated calendar invite had this:

Please be sure to review the Harvard Repository large data support documentation: https://support.dataverse.harvard.edu/large-data-support

and bring questions or just feedback -
Ok, sounds good. I'll just announce the new webpage, then, if there are no notes or whatever to link to. Thanks!
